intro: Aechmea echinata, commonly known as the spiny pineapple, is a striking bromeliad native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces a tall, branched inflorescence that bears showy, violet to purple flowers. Its leaves are typically blue-green in color and can grow up to 1 meter in length. Aechmea echinata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments.
